Docs.summary: Provides type converters for converting objects to and from objects of other types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See the base classes <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.ExpandableObjectConverter> for important usage notes.

Docs.param: An object that provides contextual information.
The type of object to convert.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this converter can convert an instance of a specified type to a .
Docs.returns: if objects of the specified type can be converted; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks As implemented in this class, this method returns `true` only if `sourceType` is a <xref:System.Uri>.
The `context` parameter is not used. See **Notes for Inheritors**.

block.para: Override this method to provide your own conversion requirements. Use the parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked. This parameter can be ; therefore, always check it. Also, properties on the object can return a null reference ().

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, Type destinationType);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that provides contextual information.
The language and culture that are used during the conversion.
The object that you want to convert.
The type that you want value converted to.
Docs.summary: Converts a to an object of the specified type.
Docs.returns: The new of the designated type. As implemented in this class, the object must be a . The object expresses the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] of the serialized image.

remarks.format:
## Remarks As implemented in this class, `value` must be a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource>.
As implemented in this class, `destinationType` must be a <xref:System.Uri> or the <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.
The `culture` parameter is not used. See **Notes for Inheritors**.

Docs.exception: The is not a type that can be converted to.
An error occurs when serializing the image.

block.para: Override this method to provide your own conversion. Use the parameter to specify the language and culture. Use the parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked. This parameter can be ; therefore, always check it. Also, properties on the object can return a null reference ().

block.para: Override this method to provide a method for obtaining selected objects for the types. Use the parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked. Use the array to designate the properties to include or to exclude.
